{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3484178,"name":"Falon Clark","username":"Tatiman-Dev","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tatiman-dev/{size}/236095_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-16T03:29:01.624Z","cooked":"

Hello! My team recently got some krakens for our swerve drive’s drive motors, and I’m looking for some info on using CTRE’s TorqueCurrentFOC control requests, below I have some questions that I’d love answers to!

  1. I know that I can get my kT gain for converting nM to amps, but how do I actually get that nM? The PPLib DriveFeedforward class has a few values that seem like they could be my wheel forces, but I’m not sure which one. So how do I actually determine wheel forces for my torque feedforward?
  2. How do I tune my PID and FF? All of my gains are in Amps per Whatever, not volts, and I don’t know how to get a good mental model for guesstimating that. Is it just guess and check? Or is there a method to my madness

I’m sure there’s more things ill want to know, so I may ask more as this thread evolves lol. Code examples are much appreciated!
